iati-activity.title: WaterAid Sierra Leone
iati-activity.description: As Sierra Leone is a post-conflict country WaterAid Sierra Leone works to build capacity to deliver sustainable water, sanitation and hygiene services as the country moves from humanitarian relief to a development focus.We focus on Community-led Total Sanitation and the Local Millennium Development Goals Initiative approach, and we have already started supporting local development in Kenema and Pujehun, the districts in which we will be working. These areas are felt to be the most marginalised areas, under-served in water and sanitation and least likely to be served through the efforts of government and other agencies.
iati-activity.activity-date: Financial year that WaterAid (re)started activities within the country

contact-info.mailing-address: Open data at WaterAid, 47-49 Durham Street, London, SE11 5JD, UK

budget.period-start: Forward looking data for WaterAid's 2012-2013 financial year (1st April to 31st March) are drawn from WaterAid's approved aspirational budgets and are estimates as at March 2013. The actual figures achieved will vary depending on a range of factors including the securing of the funding needed, challenges faced in the countries, etc.
budget.period-end: End of WaterAid 2012-13 financial year (1st April to 31st March)
